text: Hi Romone, sorry not to get back to you sooner.
Those are both really exciting careers.
Perhaps I can start by telling you a bit about myself and the work I've done, and the company I work for to give you a picture of VFX.

So my background is this: when I was at school I was quite maths-y and I enjoyed art so I took Maths, Physics and Art A Levels. Unlike you I didn't know what I wanted to do for a job when I left school so I went to Manchester Uni and studied maths (my dad thought it would be good for me to have a 'solid subject' at uni).

When I was at Manchester I found out about VFX by going around one of the VFX companies in London, a company called MPC. I realised I would really like to work doing vfx so applied to do a 1 year post graduate computer animation course at Bournemouth University.

When I finally finished all my studying I got a job in the vfx industry. I have done quite a few roles, moving around a bit, but all computer based. I've had a chance to work on films like Harry Potter and The Order Of The Phoenix and Interstellar (and some less successful ones too!)
I did these computer animation roles for 9 years and I now work as an 'Artist Manager' which is a career development coach.
I'm just going into a meeting now so I'll write a bit more later...

A little bit of informtion about the company I work for: My company is called DNEG and they work on VFX films (ie superhero movies, Harry Potter - live action with CG in it). We also work on TV show and we also do full CG films (like Shrek)
We have lots and lots of people who work here and they do a lot of different roles - including animators and directors.

Would you mind telling me a bit about you? What subjects you enjoy at school? what you know about directing or animation? (just so I know if there's any useful information I can tell you) and what you think sounds cool about being a director or animator?
When I was your age I had very little idea about what types of jobs I could get when I grew up, or what the jobs would be like so please feel free to ask big or small questions and I'll try and help!
